items.brsf1: If you want to make accurate predictions, you should use information about a person's ethnic group when deciding if they will perform well.
items.brsf2: If your personal safety is at stake, it's sensible to avoid members of ethnic groups known to behave more aggressively.
items.brsf3: When the only thing you know about someone is their race, it makes sense to use your knowledge of their racial group to form an impression of them.
items.brsf4: Law enforcement officers should pay particular attention to those social groups more heavily involved in crime, even if this means focusing on members of particular ethnic groups.
items.brsf5: Law enforcement officers should act as if members of all racial groups are equally likely to commit crimes.
items.brsf6: It is always wrong to avoid someone because members of their racial group are more likely to commit violent crimes.

items.mr3: It is easy to understand the anger of Black people
items.mr4: Discrimination against Black people is no longer a problem
items.mr5: Black people have more influence upon school desegregation plans than they ought to have
items.mr6: Black people are getting too demanding in their push for equal rights
items.mr7: Black people should not push themselves where they are not wanted
